flawed_nl_solution:
In the full decks, John has a total of 52 cards in a full deck of cards * 3 full decks of cards = <<52*3=156>>156 cards.
A half-full deck of cards contains 52 cards in a full deck of cards / 2 = <<52/2=26>>26 cards.
So from the half-full decks, John has a total of 26 cards * 3 half-full decks = <<26*3=87>>87 cards.
This is a total of 156 cards from full decks + 87 cards from half-full decks = <<156+87=243>>243 cards.
After throwing some in the trash, he now holds a total of 243 cards - 34 trashed cards = <<243-34=209>>209 cards.
#### 209

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 78, not 87. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
